summary: Build a personal dedication website for Sona with a large hero image and an interactive “How well do you know Sona” quiz; the quiz-side photo should be removed entirely (no image displayed) since it is failing to load and the user no longer wants it.
architectural_notes: Quiz should track score across 3 questions and render a final results state after the last question.
Celebration animation should be reusable for correct-answer feedback and final-results display.
Use sanitized asset filenames (no spaces/parentheses/special characters) and ensure components reference the exact built path to prevent image load fallback (e.g., “Photo coming soon”).
Hero image should use a cute built-in/static asset (not user-uploaded photos) and must reliably load from `frontend/public/assets/generated/` without fallback.

If switching to a user-provided hero image, add it as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with a sanitized filename and update HeroSection to reference the exact `/assets/generated/...` path.

Quiz section: placement/layout is approved; only swap the referenced static asset to the newly provided image (sanitized filename under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`) and ensure the `` matches the exact built path.
Quiz section: remove the quiz-side photo entirely (no desktop sticky image and no mobile inline image) and ensure the layout remains responsive without an image or image-fallback UI.
known_issues: Build/publish attempt failed with an internal configuration error; user requested retry.
Quiz page image is not visible for the user (image not loading/displaying).
Quiz image placement is correct, but the Quiz section is currently showing the wrong image; needs to be swapped to the newly provided correct image asset.
User reports the UI shows the fallback message “photo could not be loaded”, indicating the referenced image asset is still failing to load in production.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page personal dedication website that clearly communicates that it is for “someone very special”, with English user-facing text throughout.
Provide a simple, centralized way to customize the dedication content (e.g., names, short message, key moments, and optional quotes) without editing multiple components.

Design and apply a creative, coherent visual theme for the site (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a heartfelt dedication; enforce the theme consistently across all sections (avoid blue/purple-dominant palettes).

Implement core sections commonly expected for a dedication page: hero/cover section, a short dedication letter/message section, a highlights/timeline or “favorite moments” section, and a simple closing section (signature-style).
Add basic navigation and usability: a sticky or top navigation with anchors to each section, smooth scrolling, and responsive layout for mobile and desktop.
Add generated static images as part of the site design and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).
Update the dedication site’s visible title text to “For Sona”, including the hero headline and the top-left brand/title text in the sticky navigation.

Make the hero section’s main image prominently large and ready to be replaced by a provided photo later; implement a clear placeholder/fallback so the hero section still looks good before the photo is added.
Add a new dedicated section after the hero section titled “How well do you know Sona” that behaves like a 3-question multiple-choice quiz with scoring.

Implement quiz question 1 exactly as specified: question text “What is Sona's favourite food?” with options “icecream”, “pizza”, “biriyani”, where “biriyani” is the only correct answer; choosing the correct answer triggers a celebration animation.

Implement quiz question 2 exactly as specified: question text “What is Sona's favourite song?” with correct option “Tum Hi Ho” and wrong options “Sahiba” and “Apna Bana Le”; choosing the correct answer triggers the same celebration animation used in question 1.

Implement quiz question 3 exactly as specified: question text “which of the of the following cant sona handle very well?” with options “Loud sounds”, “Spicy food”, “her health”, and “all of the above”, where “all of the above” is the correct answer; choosing the correct answer triggers the same celebration animation.

After the third question is answered, show a final results view that displays a message based on total correct answers (0–3) using the exact messages provided, and play the celebration animation when the results are shown.
Update the sticky top navigation to include an anchor link to the new quiz section.
Add the quiz content (title, questions, options, correct answers, and result messages) to the centralized content configuration so it can be edited in one place.

Update the last section (ClosingSection) to display the user-provided dedication as a single, simple paragraph addressed to “chona”, and update the signature line to “with love, your bakku.” The dedication text must be stored in the centralized content configuration (frontend/src/content/dedicationContent.ts) and rendered from there.
Add the two user-uploaded photos to the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use the *second uploaded photo* as the main Hero photo on the first section/page.
Display the *first uploaded photo* as a smaller, off-to-the-side image within the Quiz section/page without breaking mobile responsiveness.
Remove the site content/sections starting from the “A Message From the Heart” section through the Moments section, while keeping the user’s dedication paragraph in the Closing section intact.

Update the Hero section to display the *second uploaded photo* ("WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM (1)-1.jpeg") as the main hero photo by wiring it to the image used in `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx` (currently `/assets/generated/sona-hero-photo.dim_1600x2000.jpg`).

Update the Quiz section to display the *first uploaded photo* ("WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM-1.jpeg") as the side image by wiring it to the image used in `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx` (currently `/assets/generated/sona-quiz-side-photo.dim_1200x1600.jpg`). Maintain responsive behavior (no layout break on mobile).

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx` to reference the renamed hero photo asset (replacing the current `src="/assets/generated/WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM (1)-1.jpeg"`).

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx` to reference the renamed quiz side photo asset (replacing the current `src="/assets/generated/WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM-1.jpeg"`).

Add a new cute, non-user-provided hero image as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and use it as the Hero section’s main image instead of the user-uploaded WhatsApp photo currently referenced in `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx`.
Add a new more cartoony cute hero image as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and ensure it can be loaded directly via `/assets/generated/...` without relying on the backend.

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx` to use the new cartoony hero image filename in the main hero photo `` (currently `src="/assets/generated/cute-hero-photo.dim_1600x2000.jpg"`).

Add a new, different cute non-user-provided hero portrait image as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` (sanitized filename, no spaces/special characters), to replace the current cartoony hero image that the user rejected.

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx` to use the new hero image asset as the main hero photo (replace the current `src="/assets/generated/cute-hero-photo-cartoony.dim_1600x2000.jpg"` with the new filename), keeping the existing fallback behavior intact.

Add the newly uploaded image "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM.png" to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using a sanitized filename (no spaces/special characters), and update `frontend/src/components/sections/HeroSection.tsx` to use this new asset as the main hero photo (replacing the current `src="/assets/generated/cute-hero-photo-v2.dim_1600x2000.jpg"`) while keeping the existing `imageError` fallback behavior intact.

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx` to use the newly added sanitized `/assets/generated/...` PNG as the Quiz section side photo (replacing the current `src="/assets/generated/WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM-1.jpeg"`). Keep the current responsive behavior (hidden on small screens, sticky on large screens) and ensure the layout does not break on mobile.

Fix the Quiz section side image so it reliably displays for users: verify the referenced static asset exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with the exact filename used in `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx`, and update the `` to match the real file path if it does not.

In `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx`, add an image-load fallback for the Quiz side photo (similar to the Hero section’s `imageError` handling): when the image fails to load, replace it with a styled placeholder container and English user-facing text indicating the photo could not be loaded.

Update the Quiz section layout so the Quiz image is not completely hidden on small screens: render an additional mobile-friendly version of the image (or a compact card) within the Quiz content flow for small breakpoints while preserving the existing sticky side-image behavior on large screens.

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx` so the quiz side image uses the newly added sanitized PNG asset instead of the currently referenced `/assets/generated/sona-quiz-side-photo.dim_1200x1600.jpg`, while keeping the existing placement and responsive behavior unchanged (mobile inline image + desktop sticky side image) and keeping the existing image-error fallback behavior.

Update `frontend/src/components/sections/QuizSection.tsx` so the quiz side photo `` uses the newly added sanitized JPEG under `/assets/generated/` instead of the currently referenced `/assets/generated/whatsapp-image-2026-02-11-at-7-14-23-am-1-1.png`, while keeping the existing responsive behavior (mobile inline image + desktop sticky side image) and keeping the existing image error fallback behavior and English text unchanged.
Remove the Quiz section photo entirely so that no quiz-side image is rendered on any breakpoint (mobile or desktop), and remove any related image-loading fallback UI/text from the Quiz section.

Update the Quiz section layout to avoid reserving space for the removed side image (e.g., collapse the two-column grid to a single-column layout on large screens) while keeping the quiz content styling and behavior (questions, scoring, celebration animation, results view) unchanged.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a personal website for someone very special.
Set the site/page title to “For Sona” and reflect Sona-specific wording across the site.
Add a large hero image on the first page/section (photo to be provided later) and design the layout to prominently feature it.
Add a second page/section quiz titled “How well do you know Sona” with 3 multiple-choice questions and correct answers as specified.
Play a celebration animation when a correct quiz option is selected and also when showing the final results.
Show a final quiz result message after question 3 based on score: 0 “very poor Sona knowledge”, 1 “room for improvement.”, 2 “You know sona very well.”, 3 “You are a Sona fangirl.”
Update the final/closing section (last page) to display the provided dedication paragraph/letter text addressed to “chona” and signed “with love, your bakku.”
Remove the content/section from “A message from the heart” up to (but not including) the user’s dedication paragraph; keep the user’s paragraph intact.
Replace the planned user-uploaded hero photo with a cute, non-user-provided hero image (static asset) and wire it into the Hero section so no upload is required.
Try a different, more cartoony cute non-user-provided hero image (static asset) and use it as the Hero section’s main image.
Replace the current cartoony hero image with a different (better-looking) cute non-user-provided hero image style that the user approves.
Replace the current Hero section image with the new user-provided hero image the user is sending now (add as a static asset and wire into HeroSection).

Add the newly uploaded image file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM (1).png" to the frontend as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using a sanitized filename (no spaces/parentheses/special characters).

Add the newly uploaded image file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM (1)-1.png" to the frontend as a static asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using a sanitized filename (no spaces/parentheses/special characters).

Replace the currently failing image asset (showing “photo could not be loaded”) with a new user-provided file and rewire the relevant section (Hero and/or Quiz) to the new sanitized static asset path.

Add the newly uploaded image file "WhatsApp Image 2026-02-11 at 7.14.23 AM (1)-3.jpeg" to `frontend/public/assets/generated/` using a sanitized filename (no spaces/parentheses/special characters) and ensure it is served at `/assets/generated/<sanitized-filename>.jpeg`.
Remove the Quiz section photo entirely (do not render the quiz-side image on any breakpoint) and keep the Quiz layout responsive without it.
